alert.note: Alert for Stillwater; Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 9:14PM MDT until June 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Billings affecting Yellowstone and Stillwater Counties. .The Yellowstone River continues to rise at Billings and will climb to major flood stage. The river has risen above the previous record crest of 15.0 feet in 1997. This is unprecedented flooding for the Billings area. For the Yellowstone River...including Billings...Major flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Billings. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM MDT Tuesday was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 15.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 9.6 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 06/12/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Yellowstone River Billings 13.5 15.4 Tue 8 pm 12.1 10.1 9.6 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Safety message...A river Flood Warning means river flooding is expected to impact people and property in the warned area. Prepare for flooding impacts associated with the forecast river levels in your location. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon at 315 PM MDT.
